props.text: An incremental Target of 5% to reduce cost of scrap, however recognition that some high values parts can increase cost significantly.

transforms.code:
if value.getRowCount() > 0:  # Check if the dataset has rows
        return '#000000'  # Black
    else:
        return '#D5D5D5'  # Gray for error or invalid data

if value.getRowCount() > 0:  # Check if the dataset has rows

if value.getRowCount() > 0:  # Check if the dataset has rows
        # Fetch the last row index
        last_row_index = value.getRowCount() - 1
        
        # Get the planned and actual parts values from the last row
        value1 = value.getValueAt(last_row_index, 'CumulativeActualScrap')
        value2 = value.getValueAt(last_row_index, 'CumulativeTargetScrap')
        
        # Compare the values and return the corresponding color
        if(value1 > value2):
            return '#FFCCCC'  # Red
        elif (value1 == value2):
        	return '#FFFFFF' #White
        else:
            return '#CCFFCC'  # Green
    else:
        return '#FFFFFF'  # White for error or invalid data

        # Use `value.getValueAt(rowIndex, columnName)` to get specific data
        latest_row = value.getValueAt(value.getRowCount() - 1, "CumulativeActualScrap")
        return latest_row
    else:
        # Return a default or placeholder value if the dataset is empty
